Byte
 Forrest




Hello, Im 
Miguel Saavedra
 and I like to build games and other stuff :D

I have recently finished my Batchellors of Computer Science and currently am
Working towards other game projects
Bellow I have some projects ;)




Social Portals


Facebook


GitHub


Linkedin








DodgeyBalls


2016 - On Going


The Second game I have built with C++ using DirectX11, Physx 3.24 and FMOD.
The game is a simple two player game where you play as boxes you shooting balls
at each other while jumping and dodging each others balls ;).    


Game Play






Link to source code


Butter Cat and Breakfast


2016 - On Going


Just a simple doging game with original hand drawn sprites.
This was my first project using C++ and the SDL framework, other middle
ware that was used was FMOD for the sounds and Rapid json to parse in
Json data for the gameplay.  


Game Play





[Link to source code](https://github.com/chownema/GP-ASS-1-Release

docs.text:
Learning Resources




Heres some resources that I found helpful when working on my Games






Kumar, K. (2013). Learning Physics Modelling with PhysX.  


Luna, F. D. (2012). Introduction to 3D game programming with Directx 11. Dulles, 
Virginia: Mercury Learning and Information.


Microsoft. (n.d.). GitHub - Microsoft/DirectXTK: The DirectX Tool Kit (aka DirectXTK) is a collection of helper classes for writing DirectX 11.x code in C++. 
Retrieved from 
https://github.com/Microsoft/DirectXTK
